intro: Mesembryanthemum hutchinsonii, commonly known as the Cape gooseberry or ozark beauty, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and colorful flowers. The plant produces small, orange-yellow berries that are edible and have a tangy flavor. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. The flowers are typically short-lived, opening in the morning and closing by midday.
